node.title: The ACT government could soon be required to provide free period products in public places
node.alt: A hand places a small pink box containing sanitary items into a vending machine.
node.description: Sanitary products would be accessible across the ACT to anyone who needs them under a new proposal to end period poverty in the territory.
node.content:
["Sanitary products would be accessible across the national capital to anyone who needs them under a new proposal to stamp out period poverty in the ACT.", "\"Period poverty\" refers to period products becoming\u00a0unaffordable to some people \u2014 with some forced to experience their monthly cycle without sanitary products, improvising by using toilet paper, cloth or newspaper.", "Now, proposed legislation in the ACT has sought to make it the government's responsibility to eradicate the inequality, while also addressing associated stigma.", "The Period Products (Access) Bill 2022 would see some public places in Canberra, such as health facilities, public toilets and libraries stocked with free tampons, pads and other sanitary products.", "ACT Labor member Pradeep Sornaraj pushed for the bill\u00a0and said men and boys need to do much better when it comes to speaking openly and respectfully about periods.", "", "
ACT Labor member Pradeep Sornaraj says he pushed for the bill for his young daughter.(ABC News: Tahlia Roy)
", "\"I have a personal issue here. I have a small daughter, and when she grows up, I want her to be part of the community, and not miss out on anything because of something natural, which is an everyday occurrence,\" Mr Sornaraj said.", "\"I think that's a good start for people to start communicating.\"", "Mr Sornaraj has been backed by Labor MLA Suzanne Orr who is encouraging\u00a0community feedback on the exposure draft bill\u00a0before it goes before the Legislative Assembly.", "\"[The bill] will make the ACT the first jurisdiction in Australia that puts in its law that women and other people who menstruate have access to these products,\" Ms Orr said.", "And as period products expanded to include sustainable and reusable items, she said there would be options.", "\"So, within the definition of the Act, it does say period products can take in a range of things, including menstrual cups, tampons, and pads,\" Ms Orr said.", "", "
ACT Share the Dignity leader Nikki Bensch welcomes the move by those in politics to \"finally\" come on board.(ABC News: Mark\u00a0Moore)
", "Trailblazing charity Share the Dignity has been providing period products to domestic violence, youth and homelessness services nationally for seven years.", "ACT leader Nikki Bensch has welcomed the move by those in politics to \"finally\" come on board.", "\"For seven years now, the community has stepped into this period poverty void, and we're thrilled now, after all this time collecting and donating period products, the ACT government is finally stumping up and will provide these products for free,\" Ms Bensch said."]
